citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The male sun bear “Barney” is currently undergoing treatment directed by the attending veterinarian which involves
administering gabapentin twice daily. The treatment sheets show that the second (PM) dose was missed on 4/28/2023,
6/6/2023, and 6/19/2023 due to keeper staff forgetting to medicate. There are also multiple treatment sheets for different
animals that have blank spots for treatments and no notes regarding why doses were not recorded.
Not following the attending veterinarian’s instructions for medications can lead to inadequate treatment of issues and
worsened outcomes for the animals. Failure to follow facility documentation standards can also lead to mistakes in
treatment. The facility must give medications as directed by the attending veterinarian. The facility must use appropriate
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
To be corrected by 6/29/2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One female De Brazza’s monkey gave birth overnight between Sunday and Monday. When staff conducted their morning
check on Monday, the neonate was found deceased. The protocol for the facility is to contact the attending veterinarian as
soon as any births or deaths are discovered; however, the vet was not contacted until Tuesday. The attending
veterinarian stated that they expected to be contacted earlier.
Delayed communication with the attending veterinarian can impact necropsy results and assessment of potential issues.
A facility representative must observe all animals daily and then ensure a mechanism of direct and frequent
communication with a veterinarian so that timely and accurate information on problems of health, behavior, and well-being
are conveyed.
To be corrected by 6/29/2023.

In the building used for food storage, there are at least six bags of expired primate food among non-expired bags. The
expiration dates range from January 2023 to May 2023. There are no notes or tags stating that these expired bags should
not be used for diets.
Palatability and nutritive value cannot be guaranteed in expired food. Any food fed by the facility must be clean,
wholesome, and palatable to the animals. It must be of sufficient quantity and have sufficient nutritive value to maintain a
healthful condition and weight range of the animals and to meet its normal daily nutritional requirements.
To be corrected by 6/29/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The male sun bear “Barney” is currently undergoing treatment directed by the attending veterinarian which involves 
administering gabapentin twice daily. The treatment sheets show that the second (PM) dose was missed on 4/28/2023, 
6/6/2023, and 6/19/2023 due to keeper staff forgetting to medicate. There are also multiple treatment sheets for different 
animals that have blank spots for treatments and no notes regarding why doses were not recorded.  
 
Not following the attending veterinarian’s instructions for medications can lead to inadequate treatment of issues and 
worsened outcomes for the animals. Failure to follow facility documentation standards can also lead to mistakes in 
treatment. The facility must give medications as directed by the attending veterinarian. The facility must use appropriate 
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. 
 
To be corrected by 6/29/2023. 
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
One female De Brazza’s monkey gave birth overnight between Sunday and Monday. When staff conducted their morning 
check on Monday, the neonate was found deceased. The protocol for the facility is to contact the attending veterinarian as 
soon as any births or deaths are discovered; however, the vet was not contacted until Tuesday. The attending 
veterinarian stated that they expected to be contacted earlier.  
 
Delayed communication with the attending veterinarian can impact necropsy results and assessment of potential issues. 
A facility representative must observe all animals daily and then ensure a mechanism of direct and frequent 
communication with a veterinarian so that timely and accurate information on problems of health, behavior, and well-being 
are conveyed. 
 
To be corrected by 6/29/2023. 
3.82(a)

Feeding. 
In the building used for food storage, there are at least six bags of expired primate food among non-expired bags. The 
expiration dates range from January 2023 to May 2023. There are no notes or tags stating that these expired bags should 
not be used for diets.  
 
Palatability and nutritive value cannot be guaranteed in expired food. Any food fed by the facility must be clean, 
wholesome, and palatable to the animals. It must be of sufficient quantity and have sufficient nutritive value to maintain a 
healthful condition and weight range of the animals and to meet its normal daily nutritional requirements.  
 
To be corrected by 6/29/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
